item.title: #Lyft Mapping study shows crucial #OpenStreetMap road attributes are fresh and high quality in 30 North American cities, as compared to groundtruth: https://eng.lyft.com/how-lyft-discovered-openstreetmap-is-the-freshest-map-for-rideshare-a7a41bf92ec

#LG opens open-source licence compliance tool source: https://www.theregister.com/2021/06/04/lg_open_sources_fosslight/. Known as #FOSSlight, the suite helps users to ensure they are using code as permitted by its licence, looks out for known vulnerabilities in free and open-source software (#FOSS) so that developers address those holes, and can also check FOSS libraries and projects offered by third parties.
The #OpenStreetMap Mapper of the month #MotM stops in Ivory Coast this month to let us get to know Racky: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/06/01/racky.html
A short video update on the progress of #Microcosms in #OpenStreetMap at Mapping USA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n85L6LttgjU&list=PLqjPa29lMiE0NZ-ouVFWgwz8vftq7dAd1&index=10
An 8 min. video about “What is new on #OSMCha?” A Mapping USA (Spring 2021) presentation by Wille Marcel. #OpenStreetMap https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VO1dnOEKgKM

Another good read via #MDPI: “The Impact of Community Happenings in #OpenStreetMap” (https://www.mdpi.com/2220-9964/10/3/164). Effects on mappers who participated in field and remote mapping happenings: newcomers in remote mapping event tended to create lower quality but high quantity new data in places foreign to their home region; newcomers in field mapping happenings updated and enhanced existing local data with high accuracy. Advanced mappers stayed largely unaffected by happenings.

“On the Representativeness of OpenStreetMap for the Evaluation of Country Tourism Competitiveness”: https://www.mdpi.com/2220-9964/10/5/301/htm. The study of #OpenStreetMap and World Economic Forum #WEF tourism data on eight parameters indicative of the tourism development in 130 countries shows #OSM data provide a fairly accurate picture of official tourism statistics for most variables.

#OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF draft strategic plan outline is available to consult (and probably open to comment as well, but I didn’t see where): https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/DRAFT_Strategic_Plan_Outline. The approach is to set high-level directions across all the efforts and structures of the Foundation.

#MapComplete - an easy to use #OpenStreetMap editor and map viewer - is looking for translators: https://www.reddit.com/r/openstreetmap/comments/nh5mxy/mapcomplete_an_easy_to_use_editor_and_map_viewer/

Mapping USA is a free #OpenStreetMap virtual event on May 20-22nd. It includes an informal Mappy Hour, ½ day of talks, and a day of workshops, birds of a feather sessions and mapathons. Details: https://osmus.civicrm.org/civicrm/event/info?reset=1&id=23

#OpenStreetMap mappers use different approaches to model various types of intersections. The more the number of roads intersect, the more complex the intersection becomes. In this guide, #Mapbox is presenting different cases of intersections with their best practices and recommendations to follow during mapping: https://labs.mapbox.com/mapping/mapping-for-navigation/modeling-intersections-for-map-navigation/. While you are there, be sure to check the other guides they have.
An explanation of the #OSM-Carto road rendering system and its issues and limitations: http://blog.imagico.de/navigating-the-maze-part-1/. #OpenStreetMap #OSMCarto

The #Indoor Mapping Landscape in 2021: https://geoawesomeness.com/the-indoor-mapping-landscape-2021-mappedin/. Getting lost indoors might become just as rare as getting lost outdoors. That’s the promise at least, as indoor mapping use cases are popping up regularly as more businesses are realizing the benefits of indoor maps. Is indoor mapping only a business use case? #OpenStreetMap
#OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM series meets Besfort Guri from Kosovo this time: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/05/01/besfort-guri.html

Interesting read about road categorization in #OpenStreetMap vs. official planning documents, and the application of OpenStreetMap’s Ground Truth rule: - https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Tim%20Couwelier/diary - https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Good_practice#Map_what.27s_on_the_ground

#Session messenger app audit report is published: https://getsession.org/session-code-audit/. The major takeaway, they say, is Session’s cryptographically sound and a few issues were raised, most of which have already been patched, and couple of low impact issues remain, but they were mostly related to deliberate design choices.
The #OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF now offers a file management and collaborative writing platform based on #Nextcloud: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/xamanu/diary/396501.

Looking for more things to map in your area of interest? Use this tool to measure the #StreetComplete-ness level to get an idea of what could be improved: https://streetcompleteness.haukauntrie.de #OpenStreetMap

Celebrating the 500th #MapComplete contributor in a bit more than a year. You can easily contribute details on bicycle shops and pumps, playgrounds, public bookcases and much more, and you can create your own theme. # OpenStreetMap https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Pieter%20Vander%20Vennet/diary/396426

With the #Campersites contribution theme on #MapComplete, there is now an even easier way for #campers to contribute #OpenStreetMap data related to places to sleep, to dump waste, to get provisions, etc.: https://mapcomplete.osm.be/campersite. (Via #OSM Diaries: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/joost%20schouppe/diary/396150)
